title: Top in Control of Corruption
description: In 2023, Norway achieved a perfect score of 100 in the Control of Corruption percentile rank, indicating exceptional governance and minimal corruption.

title: Universal Financial Inclusion for Older Adults
description: As of 2021, 100% of Norwegians aged 25 and above have access to financial institutions or mobile money services, showcasing complete financial inclusion.

title: Universal Financial Inclusion for Educated Population
description: In 2021, every Norwegian aged 15+ with secondary education or more had access to financial services, marking 100% inclusion.

title: Rapid GNI Per Capita Growth
description: Norway experienced a remarkable 25.02% growth in GNI per capita in 2022, reflecting strong economic performance.

title: Near-Universal Primary School Enrollment
description: In 2017, Norway achieved a net primary school enrollment rate of 99.88%, ensuring almost all children receive primary education.

title: Low Male Mortality from Air Pollution
description: The mortality rate for Norwegian males due to air pollution was just 9.4 per 100,000 in 2019, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Maternal Mortality
description: In 2023, Norway reported a maternal mortality ratio of just 1 per 100,000 live births, highlighting outstanding maternal healthcare.

title: High Government Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Norway's government health expenditure per capita was $7,447.64, reflecting a strong commitment to public health.

title: High Health Expenditure in PPP Terms
description: Norway's health expenditure per capita in PPP terms was $8,505.55 in 2022, ensuring high-quality healthcare access.

title: High Consumption for Bottom 40%
description: In 2022, the bottom 40% of Norway's population had a mean consumption of $49.42 per day, indicating equitable wealth distribution.

title: Low Tariff Rates on All Products
description: In 2021, Norway's bound rate for all products was 2.83%, promoting free trade and economic openness.

title: Minimal Tariff Rates on Primary Products
description: Norway's bound rate for primary products was only 0.56% in 2021, supporting a competitive market environment.

title: Exemplary Voice and Accountability
description: In 2023, Norway scored 1.78 in Voice and Accountability, placing it among the top nations for democratic governance.

title: Top Rank in Voice and Accountability
description: Norway achieved a perfect score of 100 in the Voice and Accountability percentile rank in 2023, reflecting robust democratic institutions.
